**The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity**

**Title:** *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity*
Compiled by Deng Yougong of the Southern Song Dynasty. Seven fascicles.
Source text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Dongxuan Section, Methods Category.

**Preface to *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity***

Of old, Fuqiu, Wang, and Guo Chong—three sages who embodied the manifestations of the Three Clarities—first revealed their traces upon Huagai Peak, extending to the wondrous realms of Miaogao in the east and west of Jiangnan. Their sacred titles and auspicious signs were clearly transmitted in the *Jade Tablets*, and thus shall not be elaborated here. Their works brought blessings to the world, vast and beyond comprehension.

Later, in the *Book of the Great Clarity’s Subjugation of Demons*, they expounded this teaching precisely in the *jiawu* year of the Lower Epoch’s mortal era. During the reign of the Song Dynasty’s Chongxing Great Dao, on the fifteenth day of the eighth month in the fifth year of Chunhua, a colossal immortal in the flesh beheld upon the mountain’s summit five-colored radiance of precious light piercing the heavens. The following dawn, he traced the source of the light to the ethereal altar of the Three Clarities. There, he dug three feet deep and unearthed a golden casket. Upon opening it, he discovered a set of golden tablets inscribed with jade script—a secret formula of the Celestial Heart, titled *The Orthodox Method*.

Reverent indeed! This *Orthodox Method* is the heart-guard of the Jade Emperor, the true scripture of the Great Clarity, the wondrous Dharma of the Most High, and the numinous writings of the Three Caverns, together forming the fourfold register of scriptures. These are the *Dongxuan*, *Dongshen*, and *Dongzhen* Lingbao texts, originating from the natural inception of the Dao and virtue.

The great adept was the lay scholar Rao, styled Dongtian. Though he obtained the secret texts, he did not yet grasp the essentials of their jade protocols and ritual applications. He then encountered a divine being who directed him to seek instruction from Master Tan, styled Zixiao. From Zixiao, he received the Dao. Zixiao further instructed him to visit the Heavenly Equal Benevolent Sage Emperor of Mount Tai, where he obtained the Perfect Wondrous Jade and petitioned for the aid of yin soldiers.

The great adept became the first patriarch of the Celestial Heart, titled *Orthodox Method Meritorious Minister, Daily Attendant of the Northern Culmen, and Commander of the Demon-Quelling Court*. At his ascension, he transmitted the method to his disciple Zhu Jianguan, styled Zhongsu. Zhongsu then passed it to You Daoshou, who in turn transmitted it to the *Tongzhi Lang* Zou Ze. Zou Ze conveyed it to my own master of talismanic methods, Master Tianxin, and thus it has been transmitted to me, Yougong, to the present day.

Now, Huagai Peak is the ethereal realm of the Three Clarities’ manifestation, where only the Numinous Altar of the Primordial Sovereign exists, devoid of Daoist dwellings. Thus, the name of Huagai was unknown to the people of the time. Here, I present the general origins of the scriptural register.

In the twenty-fifth year of King Zhao of Zhou, on the twenty-eighth day of the twelfth month at noon, the Old Lord transmitted the *Dao* and *Virtue* scriptures to Guan Yin, along with the *Great Clarity’s Nine Elixirs*, the *Hidden Writings of the Eight Heavens*, and the *Western Ascension’s Admonitions*. Yin passed them to the Perfected Du, who then transmitted them to the Lesser Perfected Yin—this marks the natural inception of the Dao and virtue.

By the second year of Guanghe in the Han Dynasty, the Supreme Pole Perfected Xu, on Mount Tiantai, transmitted the *Lingbao* scriptures to the Left Immortal of the Supreme Pole, Weng the Perfected. These are the ancestral texts of the *Dongxuan* and *Dongshen* registers.

Later, in the first year of Han’an during the reign of Emperor Shun of the Later Han, on the first day of the fifth month, the Old Lord descended upon Mount Heming and bestowed upon Heavenly Master Zhang the twenty-four secret registers, seals, and other talismans. At the Jade Bureau Abbey, he transmitted the methods for prolonging life and beheading demons—these are the foundation of the *Zhengyi* Alliance of Might.

From the Zhou, Qin, Han, and Wei dynasties onward, though the Three Scriptures were transmitted in the world, their regulations and ranks remained obscure. In the second year of Xingning during the reign of Emperor Ai of Jin, on the *jiazi* day of the first month—the Day of the First Farmer—the Purple Void Primordial Sovereign, the Lady of Southern Marchmount, first revealed the celestial circumstances to Yang the Perfected, the Eastern Flower’s Assistant Director of Destinies. At that time, the celestial scriptures and precious texts were written in cloud scripts, dragon seal scripts, and the eightfold assembly of characters—beyond the comprehension of the mortal world.

The Perfected One possessed separate talismanic texts and scriptural essentials, which he transformed into clerical script. From then on, their transmission flourished, becoming the origin of the *Shangqing* tradition.

Our *Orthodox Method* alone emerged during the flourishing era of the Great Song. On this mountain, the immortal traces of Qiaoxian Abbey remain evident. Alas! Without the right person, the lineage’s essence gradually faded. I, who uphold this teaching in its latter days, have presumptuously taken up its principles. Grieving the decline of the Dharma, I earnestly received my master’s instructions and personally inherited the secret essentials and talismanic writings of the Fourfold Register of the Most High. How could I dare not refine my thoughts and mobilize my spirit, lest I betray the former sages?

Thus, I have meticulously edited the wondrous Dao I received, compiling *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart* into two fascicles, upper and lower, still in summary form. The talismans and incantations used by contemporary ritual masters are all those of the Northern Emperor, which I have separately compiled into three fascicles, titled *Talismanic Writings of the Northern Emperor*. These exist outside the *Orthodox Method*, along with the secret registers and charts for cultivating the Three Caverns and Fourfold Registers.

For those who transmit the teachings and cultivate the Dao, the registers they bestow shall deliver and liberate the living, guiding all to return to the Great Dao.

Compiled by Deng Yougong.

**Fascicle One of *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity***

The Three Radiant Qi of the Pristine Essence

The Three Radiants are the sun, moon, and stars.

**Solar Qi**
The Solar Lord’s qi is rooted in its essence. When drawing solar qi, one must face its direction. Visualize the solar orb, its radiance like crimson flame.

**Lunar Qi**
The Lunar Lord’s qi is derived from the sun. The sun’s position advances daily at *mao* (5–7 a.m.), shifting between the two palaces every five days. For example, on the first day of the lunar month, begin at *mao* (east), with noon (*wu*) directly at *wu* (south). The second day follows the same pattern. On the third day, after noon, the position retrogrades past *yin* (3–5 a.m.); thus, at noon, begin at *yin* (east-northeast), and when *mao* (east) reaches *si* (south-southeast), noon corresponds to the moon’s presence in *si*. Visualize the lunar palace, its radiance like warm jade or silver.

**Celestial Stem Qi**
The Celestial Stem Star lies approximately three *zhang* from the handle of the Dipper. As the verse states:
*"Each month it ever rests at *xu*,
At every hour, *Po Jun* appears.
To know its true location,
Face or turn—ask the primal cause."*

When the lunar phase has passed the general, apply *xu*; if not yet passed, apply *xuan*. Count the hours to determine the moment for drawing qi, which is where the Celestial Stem establishes *Po Jun*. "Facing or turning" refers to the visualization of yin and yang days.

On yang days, the Celestial Stem moves forward. Visualize its face like blazing fire, clad in a robe of red silk, with three-colored qi—azure, yellow, and red—crowning its head. Its mouth emits flames ten thousand *zhang* long. With the left hand, form the Celestial Stem’s Demon-Slaying Seal (the *Ju Xie* mudra). In the right hand, it holds a precious pearl, which it draws back into its mouth along with the qi. As you visualize, the firelight becomes fine as thread or mist, shimmering with sound, bathing your body.

On yin days, the Celestial Stem moves in reverse. Visualize its face like warm jade, clad in plain silk, with three-colored qi—azure, red, and yellow—rising from its crown. Its mouth emits silver light ten thousand *zhang* long, fine as thread, shimmering with sound. The left hand forms the seal at the waist, while the right wields the Sword of Samādhi Fire. Upon completion, draw the qi into the mouth and employ it as needed. Adhere to this method without fail; do not disclose it lightly. Exercise caution.

**Invoking and Absorbing Solar Qi**
When the sun has risen three *zhang* high, determine its directional position. Face the sun, burn incense, and bow nine times in silence, reciting:
*"Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the Solar Lord, the August Emperor of the Sun, and the divine immortals of the Solar Palace to bestow the radiant true qi of *Yao Guang*, infusing it into my body."*

Next, press the *mao* mudra and silently recite the Solar Lord’s esoteric name, *Yu Yi*, nine times. Upon visualizing the true qi, silently recite the Solar Lord’s Seven Slaying Incantation:
*"Om va [ ] ra [ ] [ ] li svāhā."* (Once.)

**Absorbing Lunar Qi**
When the moon has risen three *zhang* high, determine its directional position. Face the moon, burn incense, and bow nine times in silence, reciting:
*"Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the August Sovereign of the Lunar Palace, the divine immortals of the Lunar Mansion, to bestow the radiant true qi of *Yao Guang*, infusing it into my body."*

Next, press the *you* mudra and silently recite the Lunar Lord’s esoteric name, *Jie Lin*, nine times. Upon visualizing the true qi, silently recite the Lunar Lord’s Seven Slaying Incantation for the Self:
*"Om va miṃ ra jī ra svāha saha."* (Once.)

Inhale the white qi through the nose, swallowing once every nine breaths. Repeat this nine times, ingesting nine mouthfuls of qi. Upon completion, bow in silent gratitude and withdraw.

**Invoking and Absorbing Celestial Stem Qi**
When the sun has risen three *zhang* high, determine the position of the Celestial Stem. Burn incense, press the *chen* mudra, and silently recite the incantation:
*"Spirit of the sun, spirit of the moon, conjoined beneath the Dipper.
The true qi of the Celestial Stem descends to bathe my form.
Expel the perverse, embrace the upright; eternally preserve long life.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"* (Thrice.)

Visualize the Celestial Stem, bow nine times in silence, and recite:
*"Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the Great Sage of the Celestial Stem, the Star Lord *Po Jun*, to bestow the radiant true qi of *Yao Guang*, infusing it into my body—heart, five viscera, six bowels, three hundred sixty bones, and eighty-four thousand pores—driving out pathogenic qi and demonic qi."*

Recite the incantation:
*"Yearly calamities, monthly misfortunes, daily disasters, hourly afflictions—
Expel the perverse, banish the foul.
All spirits aid me, my body enters the *Kui Gang*.
Humans take refuge, demons submit.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"* (Once.)

Blow upon the left *chen* mudra, form the Sword Mudra with the right hand, and recite the Celestial Stem’s True Qi Incantation:
*"Heavenly Emperor’s sacred decree, girded with the Celestial Stem—
Why do the malevolent ghosts of the five directions not perish?
With a single inhalation of radiant light, ten thousand demons cower in hiding.
Great Sage of the Celestial Stem, slay into the heart of ghosts.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"* (Thrice.)

Inhale and swallow the qi three times. Then recite the Celestial Stem’s esoteric name, *Fei Xian*, three times, and draw in three more mouthfuls of qi. Next, silently recite the hidden incantation:
*"Om hūṃ hūṃ nuṃ ta li svāhā."*
Draw in three more mouthfuls of qi, totaling nine. Bow nine times in gratitude and withdraw.

**Concluding Remarks**
If a ritual master can invoke the qi of the Three Lights without negligence day or night, their merit will be perfected in a thousand days. Their complexion will flourish, their body will grow robust and light, and they will be spared from all ailments. Should they persist without weariness for a lifetime, their attainment of immortality and divine power will be beyond description. Even if they only cultivate this for a thousand days, when treating illness, they need not calculate directions or engage in visualization—merely a single thought to project qi, blown upon the afflicted, will naturally restore health, subdue all malevolent forces, and command reverence.

**Treating Illness and Deploying Talismans**
When relieving the suffering of the people, expelling perverse influences, or treating illness, first accept the petition and affix the seal. Then, before the divine generals, pray and invoke the officers. Instruct the afflicted’s household to prepare incense and await your arrival. If the possessing spirit is stubborn, transform your steps into the *Gang* pace. Begin by casting a distant net from the altar, commanding it to enclose the demonic entity. Then dispatch several divine generals, leading spirit soldiers to apprehend it. Only then may you depart. As you leave the altar, strike the table thrice, form the Jade Purity Mudra with both hands, and chant the syllable *ti* seven times, visualizing all divine officers gathered before you. Lead them forth, and upon nearing the afflicted’s home, dismount.

Once the net is cast and commands issued, grasp the Demon-Seizing Mudra with the left hand and the Sword Mudra with the right. Face north, inhale a mouthful of qi, and recite the incantation:
*"I summon the Four Saints to swiftly seize the general—urgently!
Go forth for me, seize the perverse ghost, and let none escape.
Swiftly, swiftly!"*

Form the mudra, visualize the Four Divine Generals leading troops to apprehend the demonic spirit, and blow the mudra toward them. Upon reaching the afflicted’s doorstep, stand in the *ding* stance, press the appropriate mudra, and silently recite:
*"Open the Gate of Heaven—*hai* mudra.
Seal the Door of Earth—*si* mudra.
Leave the Human Gate—*shen* mudra.
Block the Demon’s Path—*yin* mudra.
Lay the Golden Beam horizontally, raise the Jade Pillar vertically—
From *chen* to *sha*.
Gather the *Gang* qi—*chen* mudra.
Press the Dipper Mudra.
Seal with the Dipper Seal.
All spirits conceal themselves, ten thousand demons perish.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"*

Next, trace the Dipper, cover your head to conceal your body, and recite while gathering with your hands:
*"Greed, Vastness, Prosperity, Literature, Valor, Destruction—on the left.
[...]—on the right."*

Form the *Tianding* mudra with both hands, pressing the index fingers to the base of the thumbs and the thumbs to the sides of the middle fingers. Visualize the Orthodox Unity Perfected One standing before you.

Next, invoke in meditation:
To my left stands the Azure Emperor of the East, girded with a sword;
To my right stands the White Emperor of the West, girded with a sword;
Before me stands the Vermilion Emperor of the South, girded with a sword;
Behind me stands the Black Emperor of the North, girded with a sword.

Then visualize the divine generals, officers, and soldiers of the courtyard arrayed in formation, encircling you.

If the malevolent spirit is fierce and hurls bricks or stones, reinforce your protection with this incantation:
*"I humbly invoke the Moon Prince of the West,
Dispatch the Five Lords of Iron and the Great Sage Canxian to my side.
By the decree of the Northern Emperor—
Hasten, hasten, swiftly, swiftly!"*

Face west and visualize the Moon Prince’s attendants: five hundred Daoist adepts in white robes, wearing iron crowns and wielding swords. Recite the incantation thrice, draw *qi* three times, and blow it to your left and right.

Then recite:
*"Spirits of the Northern Dipper, shield and protect my body.
Hasten, hasten, by statute and ordinance!"*

Visualize the Northern Dipper hovering above your head—thus, no evil dare assail you.

Next, enter the afflicted’s home. With the *killing* mudra in your left hand and the *sword* mudra in your right, knock on the door three times. Command the door gods to bar all passage to ghosts and malevolent spirits—swiftly, swiftly!

At the door of the patient’s chamber, instruct the patient to prepare incense and tea. Then, step the *Gang* and conceal yourself within the Dipper’s curve. Silently summon the generals, issue commands, and order the local earth god to seize the malevolent spirit. Burn talismans to fumigate the patient’s body. If talismans are not burned, proceed at will to capture the spirit.

The ritual master inhales the patient’s *qi*, then draws a mouthful of water and sprays it onto the patient’s body. Form the *exorcism* mudra with the left hand and the *sword* mudra with the right at the patient’s side. Instruct the patient to close their eyes while fumigating their hands with incense and shouting the command. If the malevolent spirit is male, it will tremble on the left; if female, on the right. If it is a ghost, it will tremble.

*"By the decree of the Supreme Emperor,
Thus performed, the malevolent spirit shall be bound and expelled!"*

Prepare talismanic water and the like for the patient to ingest. Then, recite the purification incantation to cleanse the body. The ritual master closes their eyes, forms the *thunder* mudra thrice to the left and right, and recites the *Dutian Great Thunder Lord* incantation once. Inhale the crimson-red *thunder qi* from the southeast, blow it forth, and visualize it transforming into the flashing lightning of the Five Thunders.

Strike with the *thunder* mudra, visualizing a thunderclap shattering the patient’s home, transmuting it into a divine abode with golden steps and jade halls, its inhabitants all transformed into immortals. Only then may you depart the patient’s home. The efficacy of this method is profound—guard it as a secret.

*Here ends the first scroll of the Orthodox Heavenly Heart True Method.
The second scroll of the Orthodox Heavenly Heart True Method.*

**The Great Transformation of the Divine Spirit Method**

When a ritual master’s practice has not yet spanned many years, how can they achieve union with the divine? They must master the method of refining and transforming the spirit to attain a majestic presence. Generally, those who perform rituals can only alter their spirit through two mudras, but they cannot achieve the great inner transformation. Here, this method is transmitted in full—follow it precisely, and you will never err.

When a ritual master wishes to perform a ritual, they must first pass their hands over the incense, then wield the sword with the left hand at *mao* and the right at *you*. Recite the *Purification of Heaven and Earth* incantation three times, inhale the eastern *qi*, and blow it upon their body to purify it. Next, visualize their body as a withered tree. Then, form the *wu* mudra with the left hand and the *dou* mudra with the right. Clasp the waist, and with the left *wu* mudra, draw the fire of the heart upward from before the heart to the crown. Inhale the southern *qi* and blow it upon the left, visualizing the fire burning the body until it radiates with luminous purity.

Form the mudra with the left hand, and with the right *zi* mudra, draw the Yellow River’s water from the kidneys, guiding it upward to bathe the entire body. Inhale the northern water *qi* and blow it upon the right, visualizing all ashes and impurities washed away. Only the true *qi* remains, gleaming like a luminous pearl, gradually growing brighter. With both hands in the *dou* mudra, recite the *Great Transformation of the Spirit* incantation:

*"I am no mortal body—
My head is like dark clouds,
My hair like scattered stars,
My left eye like the sun,
My right eye like the moon,
My nose like a fire bell,
My ears like golden bells,
My upper lip the Rain Master,
My lower lip the Wind Earl?
My teeth like a forest of swords,
My ten fingers like hooks.
The Merit Officer guards my left side,
The Lord of Min Mountain commands my right.
The Lord of Lu Mountain guards my left foot,
The Left Thunder General guards my right foot.
The Right Thunder General commands my spine,
The Thirty-Six Beasts of Mount Tai and the Twenty-Eight Constellations all respond to my body.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

Recite this three times, inhale the northern *qi*, and with both hands in the *dou* mudra, raise them from before the heart to the forehead. Spread the *dou* mudra outward to the left and right, visualizing the self gradually taking the form of an infant, encircled by a sphere of red light, as if seated within a wheel. If the form grows too large, again use both hands in the *dou* mudra, moving them three steps forward from the chest, and recite the incantation:

*"By the command of the Northern Emperor, protect the wheel,
By the reverence of the Northern Emperor, treasure the wheel."*

Recite this three times, then split the *dou* mudra apart before the face, shattering the luminous halo. Visualize the self as the Heavenly Master or the True Warrior of Tianpeng, as desired. The red halo transforms into a radiant aura, enveloping the body. Conclude by knocking the teeth together as prescribed, and proceed with the ritual as needed.

**Stepping the Stars and Walking the Rites**

The method of stepping the stars (*bu gang*) values the power of visualization. As the ancients said: *"The steps of the feet are not as potent as the steps of the hands; the steps of the hands are not as potent as the steps of the heart."* Thus, one must concentrate on the true *qi* of each star and its radiant essence. When the visualization is true, the essence of the Dipper descends to witness the ritual master’s practice. Therefore, when performing rites within the *Kui* and *Cheng* constellations, all ghosts and spirits will submit without exception. The divine generals will heed your commands, and ghosts and spirits will obey your authority.

If one fails to visualize the true *qi* or conceal the Three Hun, it is called *"stepping the stars with an empty corpse"*—not only will the ritual’s power fail, but one may also incur the offense of trampling the sacred. This must be carefully heeded.

When stepping the stars, form the *dou* mudra with both hands, clasp the waist, and recite the *Concealing the Hun* incantation:

*"Three Hun youths,
Seven Po generals,
Follow my steps through the stars,
Pass through the heavenly gates,
Let none err.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

Recite this three times, then with both hands in the *dou* mudra, visualize the Three Hun entering beneath the ribs. Recite again:

*"I receive the Heart Treasure Seal of the Heavenly Master,
Wear it naturally,
Ascending from the dark netherworld to the celestial grotto-heavens.
I walk the Yu Steps, attain the Dao, and ascend as an immortal.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

Recite this three times, then with both hands in the *dou* mudra, insert them beneath the ribs to conceal the Three Hun. The ritual master visualizes their ancestral master performing the rites before them. The Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity of the North Star arrives upon purple clouds, leading the Thirty-Six Great Generals, including Tianpeng, to perform the rites with valor. They ride upon purple clouds, covering the ritual master’s body. Visualize the local earth gods and their troops encircling the ritual master.

Next, form the *yu* mudra with the left hand and the sword mudra with the right, clasp the waist, and step the stars, beginning with the *Three Terraces* (*Santai*):

Recite the incantation:

*"First Terrace, one yellow—yellow *qi*,
Dispels misfortune.
Second Terrace, two white—white *qi*,
Protects the body and secures the home.
Third Terrace, three green—green *qi*,
Cures illness and expels spirits.
Where the Terrace Stars arrive,
Great power is bestowed.
Cure illness, avert calamity,
Turn death into life.
Where the celestial talismans reach,
Evil spirits are forever severed.
The true *qi* descends,
Power and efficacy are fulfilled.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

Next, step the *Seven Stars* (*Qixing*) and recite the incantation:

*"Mysterious Northern Dipper,
The handle’s foremost star—
Greedy Wolf wields malice,
Black *qi*,
Devours ghosts and consumes spirits.
Mighty Gate shines fiercely,
Black *qi*,
Illuminating the path to clarity.
Wealth Star races through mist,
Green *qi*,
Commands the heavenly troops.
Cloud-Soaring Literary Star,
Green *qi*,
Shines upon the Upright and Chaste.
Green and red *qi*—
Martial Star of power,
The Perfected One’s assisting star.
Red *qi*—
The Great Sage of the Celestial Stem,
The Venerable Star of the Breaking Army.
Fire *qi*—
The Four Heavens are sealed,
Impure *qi* flees in haste.
Wielding axes and halberds,
Grasping the Heavenly Soldiers.
With one inhalation from the south,
Gallbladders shatter, hearts tremble.
The Spirit Lords patrol and inspect,
Listening and seeking out sounds.
The Earth Gods of the Nine Provinces,
Each is called by name.
Execute the wicked,
Protect the innocent—no light offense.
The wicked die,
The kind live.
Heads severed, limbs broken,
Bodies crushed to dust.
Ghosts and demons are swept away,
Humanity rests in peace.
Cure illness, avert calamity,
Where the talisman arrives, obey.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

Recite again:

The Five are the Heavenly Eye and Heavenly Appearance,
Pursuing the gaze like thunder and lightning.
Its radiance terrifies the Eight Extremes,
Piercing through inner and outer—nothing does not submit.

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

When the incantation is complete, proceed in order with silent memorials. Strike the teeth thrice, then act as you will.

This method steps through both the Yin and Yang Dippers, arriving at the *Gang* Star to extract it. Do not immediately turn and retreat; first stand firm. Recite the prayer:

Great Sun Sovereign of the Solar Palace,
Great Lunar Monarch of the Lunar Mansion,
Nine August Emperors of the Northern Dipper,
Star Lords of the Three Terraces and Canopy,
All divine immortals and spirit officials within the Dipper—
I humbly beseech the Perfected Ones to incline toward this great creation.
May you deign to send down the luminous true *qi* of *Yaoguang*,
Infusing my body, heart, and five viscera.
Let me gaze upon evil so that evil collapses,
Gaze upon ghosts so that ghosts perish.
Where commands are issued and upheld,
Swift resonance is attained, the Six Dippers acting as one.

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

Draw in the *qi* of the Three Lights, combine them, and swallow thrice. Then turn and retreat, returning to the Dipper’s mouth. Stand and recite the Dipper’s Mouth incantation, silently memorializing the Heavenly Gate. To exit the *Gang*, recite the *Gang*-Welcoming Dipper-Exiting incantation:

The Five Phases spur one another,
The *Gang* Sword wields might.
The Six *Jia* assist me,
The Three Terraces ward off wrong.
Heaven revolves, earth turns,
Yin and Yang part.
Attaining life and transcending the world,
Sun and moon shine together.

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

Upon reciting "Heaven revolves, earth turns," turn your body and exit the Dipper. With both hands, form the Two Dippers’ seal, lifting the *Gang* of the Dipper to enshroud yourself. Lest others tread upon defilement, take strict heed.

**Distant Enshrouding Method**
Above, spread the Heavenly Net to seize mountain specters;
Below, lay the Earthly Web to capture ghostly thieves.
In the four directions and eight bounds,
Deploy troops and array formations.
Seize and capture wayward ghosts—
Let none dare escape or slip through.
They must be apprehended;
No disobedience shall be tolerated.

Swiftly, swiftly, I invoke the Emperor’s decree!

Recite thrice, hands crossed, inhale a mouthful of northern *qi*, and cast it forth as if casting a net. Visualize the divine generals enshrouding all. Another method is called the *Black Wind Universal Heavenly Enshroud*: with both hands, trace the killing script, draw in the northern *qi*, and blow it forth.

The method stirs heaven and earth,
Commands thunder and lightning,
Deploys officers and soldiers,
Shifts mountains and peaks,
Enshrouds ghosts and spirits.
I enact the true law,
Delivering the people from suffering.
If I send you to heaven, ascend straight to the Heavenly Palace.
If I dispatch you to water, descend directly to the Watery Palace.
Within the vast expanse of heaven and earth,
Corresponding to the Six Harmonies above—
You must apprehend the ghosts that bring calamity,
Seize and bind them before the altar,
Interrogate and record their names.

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

With the left hand in the *Du Jian* seal and the right in the sword seal, inhale three mouthfuls of *qi* from the Heavenly Gate, recite the incantation thrice, and blow it toward the distance. Visualize the black *qi* of the north, dense and swirling, enshrouding all under heaven. Inhale another mouthful of *Gang* *qi* and blow it forth, then shout:

Divine generals, firmly enshroud the ghosts and spirits!

Swiftly!

The Fire-Enshrouding Dharma Name

Entering Shu to battle demons,
Summoning wind and rain without awaiting celestial talismans—these were the very talismans employed.
Yet, fearing that later generations might recklessly misuse them,
And incur the Celestial Emperor’s punishment,
They were selected and established under a distinct lineage,
Named the *Marrow of the Numinous Scripts*.
Though transmitted through the ages, the world has remained unaware.
Though I have elucidated their principles,
I dare not treat them as trivial.

Thus, I have refined their subtleties, excising the superficial. Whenever employing these talismans, examine each accompanying explanation to determine its suitability. In dispatching or memorializing, one must follow the prescribed order. Only after mastering the forms, appearances, and incantations of the talisman officers and divine generals may one summon them. With prolonged practice, their presence shall manifest before your eyes.

Hereafter are described the forms, attire, and regalia of the talisman emissaries.

The foregoing nine talismanic incantations and their applications, along with the subsequent esoteric discussions, contain not a single extraneous character. *Demon-Seizing Talisman Emissary*: Hair unbound, wielding a sword, clad in black robes and golden armor. May enter the water palaces and springs to dispatch calamities and expel ghosts. If affixed to one’s life talisman, it seizes the person’s spirit at night.

**On Subduing Epileptic and Demonic Possession**

Whenever treating those afflicted with epilepsy, demonic possession, or frenzied wandering—unaware of human affairs, naked and exposed, raving incoherently—if previous attempts at restraint have failed, first have the patient’s family submit a written petition to the altar. Once the judgment is inscribed, the ritual master first casts a distant net, ensuring all is secured. Then, prepare a statement detailing the patient’s condition and submit it to the Court of the Sacred Peak, as well as a memorial to the City God. All written documents must be kept secret. Dispatch divine generals to oversee the proceedings. In a secluded chamber, inscribe the talismans—no one else may witness this.

Select and dispatch generals and soldiers to monitor and pursue the affliction. Summon the deities of the patient’s dwelling—mountains, forests, altars, and temples—as well as the ancestral spirits, the Five Paths Earth Gods, and all relevant deities, both within and without. At the appointed hour, command them to converge and scatter in pursuit. At the patient’s home, all malevolent spirits and demonic entities from the Three Realms that have brought misfortune must be firmly restrained, awaiting the arrival of this court. No unauthorized commands or biased testimony shall be heeded. Any harm inflicted upon the imperial subjects must be verified with certainty.

On the following day—or even the same day—the ritual master arrives at the patient’s home, sword not in hand. First, purify the body and transform into the divine form. Step the Three Terraces and Seven Stars of the Pivot, advancing to the Dipper’s Mouth. Purify body and mind, silently pay homage to the Supreme Emperor, and memorialize the matter. Then, lead the assembly of all the great sage officials and generals of the ritual department in due order. Depart without looking back.

Along the way, recite the *Heavenly Vanguard Mantra* without limit. Upon arrival, cast a close net. Command the divine generals to firmly restrain and capture the demonic entities, declaring: *"The matter is concluded—cease!"* Proceed as in healing rituals, advancing together to the door.

Once the ritual actions are complete, form the Dipper Seal with the left hand and strike the door three times with the right. Then recite the *Closing Door Spell*:
*"By the Supreme’s command, block the door and seize the demonic ghosts.
All vengeful spirits vanish of themselves.
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Supreme’s statutes and ordinances!*"*

Enter the door, form the Mountain Seal with the left hand, inhale a mouthful of Northern qi, and blow it out. Visualize the Four Great Divine Generals lifting mountains to seal the door. Command:
*"Left Door Spirit, Right Door Marshal, and Five Paths Gods—secure the door tightly! Allow no demonic entities to escape. Disobedience will be met with punishment!"*

Inside the door, recite the *Locking Door Spell*:
*"Heaven’s Slayer, Earth’s Slayer, Door’s Slayer—all demonic entities, slain!
By my authority, I command the Door Gods: permit no demonic entities to escape—seize them at once!
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"*

Clasp the Great Slayer Talisman with both hands, or form the Lock Seal. Upon entering, first lift the left foot’s garment with the left hand, step the right chest three times over the threshold, and recite the *Locking Door Spell*. Then release the garment, face the North-South Dipper, inhale three mouthfuls of Northern qi toward the door, and visualize the lock sealing.

Next, have the patient’s family arrange an altar in the main hall for the divine generals, offering fresh fruits, incense, lamps, tea, paper money, and horses. The ritual master then transforms into the divine form, steps the Pivot, and summons the generals. Recite the personal secret mantras of the court’s generals, visualizing each in their proper form, and command: *"The matter is concluded."*

Then, have the patient brought out. The ritual master forms the Demon-Quelling Seal with the left hand and the Sword Seal with the right. Alternatively, hold the Heavenly Vanguard Ruler—remaining within the Pivot steps. Recite the *Subduing Blade and Sword Mantra*, form the Dipper Seal with the left hand and the Golden Blade Seal with the right, and chant:
*"Qian’s origin flows through Lu’s center,
Sun and Moon illuminate me.
Blade and edge follow my descent—
harm not my body.
By the authority of the Nine Heavens’ statutes and ordinances!"*

Upon completion, shout:
*"Divine Generals—swiftly drag forth the malevolent spirits that have brought misfortune! Hasten!"*

If the possessed patient rushes out, point the Demon-Quelling Seal at them and shout:
*"Four Upright Heavenly Pivot Generals—swiftly bind their hands! Hasten!"*

Then employ the *Capturing, Binding, Canguing, and Pillorying Mantras and Seals*. If the demon refuses to confess, use the *Paper Pellet Inquiry Method*, also called the *Heavenly Pivot’s Fiery Brain Talisman*. Invoke:
*"Heavenly Pivot Divine Kings—clad in purple robes, crowned in gold.
Divine Pivot Divine Kings—clad in vermilion robes, crowned in gold."*

On two pieces of crimson paper, inscribe the two Divine Kings. While writing, visualize them, inhale the Pivot qi, and blow it onto the brush. After inscribing nine pellets, burn them over incense and fumigate the patient’s nose—they will confess.

If they remain unyielding, recite the *Great Divine Fire-Burning Demon Spell*:
*"Great Sage Inverse Fire, flowing to the Southern Realm.
Fire Officials burn—demonic ghosts perish!
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"*

Inhale the qi of the Sun, blow it onto the brush, and inscribe a single fire character in a circle. Place it in the patient’s nose, recite the previous spell again, inhale another mouthful of solar qi, and blow it onto the patient’s crown. Burn the pellet—recovery will be swift. Through such interrogation, none will fail to submit.

Then, assess the severity and determine the appropriate course of action. Recite the *Spell for Expelling Demonic Entities from the Body*:
*"Heavenly Pivot Great Sages—upright qi flows freely.
The human body is peaceful and auspicious—demonic entities vanish.
Heavenly Pivot’s upright qi—all evil departs the body!
*Swiftly, swiftly, by the authority of the Supreme Emperor’s statutes and ordinances!*"*

Left hand forms the Heavenly Pivot mudra, right hand holds the water vessel, and the spell is recited three times. Face the Heavenly Pivot, draw in qi three times, blow it into the water, and spray it onto the patient, who is also made to drink it—thus awakening them. Then shout: *"Demonic spirits, swiftly depart the body!"* Next, administer talismanic water for the patient to swallow. Then purify the body. Next, dispatch officers to set up an altar in the patient’s home, ensuring continuous incense and lamp offerings until the patient fully recovers. Afterward, offer sacrifices to the generals and soldiers of this court, settle all matters, then issue official documents and send the troops back to the altar.

When treating demonic possession, beware of the patient wielding blades to harm the ritual master. For this subsequent section, if the case is ordinary and does not require the summoning of the ritual officer, proceed as follows:

Blades fall at my command,
Let no harm come to my body.
I act by the statutes and ordinances of the Nine Heavens!"*

Draw in the qi of the Heavenly Pivot and blow it onto both shoulders. Then, with the thumb, press the *Xuanwen* mark and recite:
*"Rescue, submit, and offer the treasure to the Emperor!
When encountering madness or demonic possession,
If the patient wields blades, do not approach.

and the Golden Blade Mudra with the right, and recite:

Draw in the qi of the Heavenly Pivot and blow it toward the patient’s hand. Strike with the right hand’s Golden Blade Mudra—the blade will fall of its own accord.

**Method for Dispersing the Qi of the Heavenly Pivot to Treat Headaches:**
For all headache treatments, press both Dipper Seals firmly against the temples. Recite the Heavenly Pivot’s true spell three times, draw in three mouthfuls of its qi, and blow it onto the head. Have the patient cough three times, then inhale three mouthfuls of the painful qi and blow it onto the ground, stamping it down with the foot. Repeat this process until the third breath of qi. Then, withdraw the Dipper Seals one hand at a time—first the right, then the left—and ask whether the pain remains. If only half the pain is to be dispelled, hold the Sword Mudra at the center without reciting the spell, first withdrawing one hand. Then, recite the spell and blow away the pain from one side, while the other side’s pain is drawn out. The side from which the hand was first withdrawn will experience greater pain—this must be kept secret.

Draw in the qi of the Dipper and, along with the mudra, blow it onto the painful spot. Then, press the Dipper Seal again, recite the spell while tracing over the *chi* character, and when the spell ends, lift the brush. Once more, form the Dipper Seal, draw in the qi of the Heavenly Pivot, and blow it onto the area. With the left hand forming the Thunder Seal, write the character *lei* (雷), recite the spell until complete, draw in the qi of thunder, and along with the mudra, blow it onto the painful spot. Then, press the Thunder Seal and trace over the *lei* character while reciting the spell. When the spell ends, lift the brush, draw in the qi of thunder, and along with the mudra, blow it onto the painful area.

Also called the *Subduing Demon Seal*.)
**Heavenly Pivot Earthly Axis Mudra**. (*Qian* and *Gen*.)
**Dipper Seal**. (Little finger enters from the back of the four fingers, concealing the third and fourth; thumb bent, pinching to straighten only the second finger.)

*End of Scroll Six of* **Orthodox Methods of the Heavenly Heart of Upper Clarity**
*Scroll Seven of* **Orthodox Methods of the Heavenly Heart of Upper Clarity** *begins*

**Yu Step Method**
Step with both feet in *Kan* and one in *Gen*, crossing into *Qian*;
Step forward with both in *Zhen*, and *Dui* does the same.
Step with one foot in *Kun* and both in *Li*, then into *Xun*;
Returning by the *Three Terraces*, one ascends to face Heaven.
Upon completing the steps, form the *Purple Tenuity Mudra*.
On *Qian*, transform the body and mount the white crane,
Drifting lightly until reaching the Heavenly Gate.
Face the *Imperial Lord*, present the matters of the heart, and petition for a compliant destiny as desired.

Then retrace the steps from the Heavenly Gate back to *Xun*,
Proceeding to the quiet chamber’s powdered altar.
At the *zi* and *wu* hours, first perform the Yu Step before the altar,
Then dishevel the hair and wield the sword, entering the altar’s center from *Qian*.
Sit upright on a stool, close the eyes, and intone the incantation:
*Qian* primordial, beneficial and steadfast,
Sun and moon conceal my form.
Ten thousand calamities cannot assail me,
My lifespan endures with Heaven’s years.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Recite again:
I am the master of the Daoist rites,
Water, fire, blades, and weapons cannot reach me,
Sickness and thieves cannot approach me.
I share the radiance of the sun and moon,
Wherever I go, all affairs prosper.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Then face the *Big Dipper* star and swallow the *Three Luminants Talisman*,
Silently declaring the direction and purpose as the talisman decrees.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Then exit from *Xun*,
At the fifth watch of the day, pay homage to the Dipper,
Draw in the upright *qi* of the Three Luminants, and swallow it into the abdomen.
Form the mudra and recite the incantation:
Supplicate the great sage of the *Heavenly Pivot*, the venerable stars of the sun and moon,
To bestow upright *qi*, infusing it into the five viscera and six bowels of your disciple [Name],
Within the eighty-four thousand pores.
Expel perverse *qi*, expel ghostly *qi*, expel the four hundred and four illnesses.
Let [Name] see perversity and perversity crumble, see ghosts and ghosts vanish, see sickness and sickness heal.
All perversities withdraw their wings,
People return to refuge, ghosts submit to subjugation.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

**Exiting the Seal Method**
Use the middle finger to flick it out,
Visualizing the *Five Thunder Envoys*, the *Thirty-Six Generals*, the *Heavenly Ding* warriors, the *Seal-Monitoring Envoys*, their forms, attire, and regalia.
Recite the incantation:
The Heavenly Seal is numinous,
Commanded by the Jade Emperor to circulate,
Overseen by the *Master of Expelling Perversity* and the *Seal-Monitoring Envoys*,
Carried forth by the *Heavenly Ding* warriors.
Perversities hear of it and their gall shatters,
The sick see it and find peace,
Those who bring misfortune perish,
Those who bring blessings thrive.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

**Entering the Seal Method**
Use the middle finger to hook it in.
Recite the incantation:
The *Heavenly Ding* warriors retrieve the Heavenly Seal,
Malevolent perversities and demons turn to dust.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

**Talisman Consecration Method**

**Talisman Consecration Method**
Hold the talisman in the right hand, while the left hand’s thumb presses down the second, third, and fourth fingers, the thumbnail pressing the base of the little finger, securing the right sleeve. Recite the incantation:
The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, great deities of Heaven’s center,
Ascend to the Golden Gates, descend to cover Kunlun.
They govern the cosmic order, regulate Heaven and Earth.
Greedy Wolf, Mighty Gate, Wealth Storage, Literary Brilliance,
Integrity and Martial Brilliance, Ruinous Star and Auxiliary Star,
Encompassing the great celestial sphere, penetrating the tiniest dust.
What disaster cannot be eradicated? What blessing cannot be attained?
The primordial imperial qi descends to shield my body.
The Most High Jade Emperor, the Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord,
The essence of the Great Mystery—if worn, proclaim:
Calm the hun-soul and po-soul, guard and protect the body’s form.
The spirit-lords of the five viscera, each ensure peace.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

**Talisman Dispatch Method**
Command [Name] Spirit to heed my words: I act by the Jade Emperor’s decree,
Aiding Heaven’s transformations, assisting the state and saving the people,
Curing illness and expelling perversities, rescuing the imperiled and upholding rectitude.
If I send you to Heaven, go directly to the celestial bureaus.
If I send you to Earth, go directly to the underworld.
If I send you to water, go directly to the watery palaces.
If I send you among humans, go at once to seize perverse demons.
Within the Three Realms, all malevolent ghosts and spirits harming people—
Regardless of rank—seize them for me.
Cure illness and expel perversities, without delay or hesitation.
Clearly receive this command; do not dare disobey.
Upon inspection, execute swiftly—go quickly, return swiftly.
I stand before the altar, sword raised in wait.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

**Water Retrieval Method**

**Water Retrieval Method**
On the *chou* day of each month, or on days governed by Heavenly Virtue and Monthly Virtue, when celestial rain descends, collect it in a bottle. Each month, align the bottle beneath the *Huagai* constellation, directing it upward toward the Celestial Pivot. On days of Heavenly Virtue and Monthly Virtue, when the stars and constellations are distinct, present your petition. Offer spirit money and horses to the Great Sage of the Celestial Pivot, Heavenly Virtue, Monthly Virtue, and the Five Thearch Dragon Lords. Visualize the host of sages descending through the celestial gate upon black clouds, transforming and entering the water brush. Employ the mudra of your original master, followed by the mudra of the Supreme Thearch.

Recite the incantation:
*"Heavenly Virtue, Monthly Virtue, Five Thearch Dragon Lords,
Regulators of the celestial order, revered Star of the Breaking Army,
Commanding divine generals, the Six Jia and Six Ding,
Foremost in might, most sacred and efficacious.
By this decree, the divine water descends to deliver all beings.
Inscribe talismans and registers to gather and slay perverse spirits,
Cure illness and expel malevolence, annihilating their forms entirely.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands."*

**Brush Consecration Method**
On *jiazi*, *gengshen*, the Six Ding, and Six Jia days—twelve days in total—bind together twelve brushes. Each brush, with its tip aligned, should measure seven *cun* and one *fen* in length. Use three tufts of purple hare’s hair, corresponding to the Three Terraces. On the *jiazi* night, when the stars and moon are clearly visible, bathe and don fresh robes. Perform the rites, burn incense, and present a memorial. Offer spirit money and horses to the Great Sage of the Celestial Pivot. Beneath the *Huagai* constellation, place twelve cups of wax tea. Form the mudra of your original master, visualize the Six Ding and Six Jia descending, transforming the brushes into twelve divine generals. First, visualize the spirit money for the local earth deity, then the Six Ding and Six Jia.

Recite the incantation:
*"Heavenly Ding warriors, Six Jia and Six Ding,
Wise and upright, wielding power most efficacious.
Demons and malevolent spirits quake in fear,
Perverse ghosts prostrate in dread.
Aid the Dao’s transformations, sweeping away perverse spirits,
Assist my methods to deliver all beings.
By this decree, the divine brush descends with swift potency,
Inscribe talismans to slay ghosts, obliterate traces and forms.
By the command of the Supreme Thearch, swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands."*

**Ink Consecration Method**
Grind two *liang* of light ink with cinnabar. Mix one *fen* each of peach oil, willow oil, and camphor oil soot. Add a small measure of clear wine, then boil with honey locust gum. Prepare this on the fifth day of the fifth month at the hour of *wu*.

Recite the incantation:
*"Six Jia and Six Ding, divine ink most efficacious,
True qi of the Five Elders, born of the Northern Thearch’s transformation,
Root of the Mysterious Origin’s Dao, slaying perverse spirits,
Human spirits purified, demonic perversities obliterated.
Inscribe talismans and present memorials, execute commands with reverence.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands."*

**Celestial Mudra**
The Dipper Mudra.

**Two-Finger Mudra**
The Master’s Mudra. Press the middle joint of the index finger.

**Root-of-Two-Fingers Mudra**
The Spirit-Transformation Mudra. First assume the Dipper Mudra posture, then clasp the middle joint of the middle finger with both hands while reciting the divine incantation.

**Sun Sovereign Mudra**
Press the upper joint of the index finger with the thumb.

**Moon Sovereign Mudra**
Press the upper joint of the fourth finger.

**Gongcao Mudra**
From *zi* to *hai*.

**Celestial Prison Method**
For dispatching documents or inscribing talismans, first perform the Spirit-Transformation Mudra, then take three steps along the *ding*-directional *gang*. Visualize two blue-robed youths bearing sword seals standing to your left and right, while you assume the role of the Warden of the Demon-Expelling Bureau. Step through the Seven Stars *gang*, having another person follow your steps to insert bamboo stakes. Then take a left-hand cord and strike each star in turn. Inscribe the Ghost-Pursuit Talisman in cinnabar, burn five hundred strings of cash before the prison gate, and visualize the Ghost-Pursuit Talisman’s envoy in urgent haste. As the fire burns, form the Ghost-Pursuit Mudra by pressing the middle joint of the fourth finger with the thumb, then clamping the second and third fingers with the thumb. Recite the incantation:

*"Celestial Prison, spiritually potent..."*

Upon completing the incantation, form the Supreme Thearch Mudra and the Celestial *Ding* Mudra in succession. Next, inscribe: *"By the command of the Supreme Thearch."* Visualize the silk strip transforming into a swirling black cloud, which coalesces into the Northern Dipper as a dark prison, awaiting the unsheathing of the sword. Form the Unsheathed Sword Mudra. Affix the characters *"Celestial Prison"* above the chamber door. Construct the prison with lime on yang days and with earthen ash on yin days. The eight stars of the Celestial Prison should each span seven *cun*. Erect the prison beneath the *Wuqu* star, with the prison itself measuring one *chi* and two *cun* in width. Use nine green bamboo stalks, each four *chi* and nine *cun* in length. Outline the stars and prison with fine ash, and mark each position with a bamboo stake. Appoint the bamboo as the prison’s straight-standing officers. Prepare nine pieces of black silk, each nine *cun* long and one *chi*, two *cun*, and two *fen* wide. Measure seven *cun* from the bamboo stakes, tie the black silk in place, and inscribe the names of the eight stars in cinnabar upon it. Post proclamations beneath the bamboo stakes, seven *cun* from the ground. Close the prison by day and open it by night to prevent disturbance, and do not use lamps or candles. When treating illness, direct the *gang* toward the patient’s chamber. For other miscellaneous matters, point the *gang* toward the monthly branch. If after two nights no signs manifest in the Celestial Prison, reissue the proclamation to summon the divine generals.

**Living Heavenly Terrace Ritual**
Construct this in the direction of *shengqi*. Offer incense and tea, and affix a paper placard inscribed: *"By the command of the Supreme Perfected Lord of Highest Clarity: the ghosts Manda, Aqini, Niqimo, Aqia, Poloni, Tepoli, and Apiluo."* Also inscribe: *"Om hum hum, all spirits bow in reverence."* Mix sand with water infused with *gansong*, *chenxiang*, *tanxiang*, and *tanxiang* incense, then trace the characters *"Living Heavenly Terrace"* upon it. Offer five fruits and lamps, and thrice present your petition, stating: *"I humbly beseech the Supreme Perfected Lord of Highest Clarity to issue commands and act in accordance with my request."* The base should be two *chi* wide and three *cun* high; the central platform, one *chi* and five *cun* wide and two *cun* high.

The upper platform shall be one *chi* wide and one *cun* high. Place a mirror at its center on the top tier. On the middle tier, position four lamps at the four corners. Before the altar, light the Seven Star Lamps, directing their stems toward the afflicted. Offer five fruits upon a tray before the altar, and place incense and lamps in each of the four directions. Inscribe four *Duzjiang* talismans to suppress the four corners. At the rear, erect a placard three fingers in width and six *chi* in length, planted into the ground, inscribed: *"I bow in reverence to the Supreme Perfected Lord of Highest Clarity."* Additionally, take a bamboo stalk seven *chi* in length and the width of a finger, inserting it seven *cun* into the earth behind the altar. Measure seven *cun* downward from the top and strike it with a seven-*cun* length of black silk. Then, consecrate the boundary with ritual water as customarily employed. Subsequently, cast the Sword Water at the Gate of Heaven while reciting the incantation:

*"Heaven vast and azure,
Earth august and boundless.
Ghosts of lingering corruption,
Dare not lurk in concealment.
Swiftly depart this prison of mine,
Hasten to another realm.
Should any defy this command,
Be severed and cast into boiling depths.
I enact the true Dharma—
How dare evil spirits withstand?
Hasten, hasten, as decreed by law!"*

Thereafter, prepare spirit money, horses, silk offerings, and miscellaneous silks to reward the divine generals. Compose a written petition to dispel and restrain the malevolent ghosts, sending them to the Sacred Peaks for confinement and judgment. Immediately thereafter, dissolve the Heavenly Prison.

**Establishing the Floral Canopy of the Prison**
The so-called *Floral Canopy* is a method transmitted from master to master. In the first month, the *zi* direction; in the second month, the *hai* direction. Follow the ten-day cycle: during the *jiazi* cycle, the *you* direction; *jiaxu*, the *wei*; *jiashen*, the *si*; *jiawu*, the *mao*; *jiachen*, the *chou*; *jiayin*, the *hai*.

*Scroll Seven of the Orthodox Methods of the Heavenly Heart of Highest Clarity concludes.*

chunks.original_text: 上清天心正法 经名：上清天心正法。 南宋邓有功编撰。 七卷。 底本出处：《正统遗藏》洞玄部方法类。 上清天心正法序 粤惟浮丘王郭冲感三圣人者，实三清之应化。 先示迹于华盖，极乎江南束西妙高之境，其封号符瑞。 翠琰传之颇明，兹不繁述。 作世福祥，大不思议。 俯为《太清伏魔经》显说，正当下元生民甲午之岁也。 遇宋崇兴大道，淳化五年八月十五日，有肉身大，夜观山顶之上，有五色宝光冲上霄汉。 翌旦寻光起处，即三清虚无瑶坛之上也。 遂掘三尺许，得金函一所，开见金板玉篆天心秘式一部，名曰正法。 钦哉，正法乃玉帝之心卫，太清之真文，太上之妙法，三洞之灵书，共成四阶之经箓。 所谓洞玄、洞神、洞真灵宝，出于道德自然之始也。 大士者，饶公处士也，名洞天。 虽获秘文，然未识诀目玉格行用之由。 复遇神人，指令师于谭先生，名紫霄，授得其道。 紫霄又令往见泰山天齐仁圣帝，得尽真妙王，又奏请助以阴兵。 大士作天心初祖，号正法功臣日直元君北极驱邪院使。 升天时，以法传弟子朱监观，名仲素。 仲素次传游道首，道首次传通直郎邹责，邹责传臣本师符法，师名天信，至臣有功传于今矣。 然华盖者，是三清应化虚无之境，独有虚皇灵坛即无道流居止。 故时人不知有华盖之名，今举经箓大略之由。 昔老君周昭王二十五年十二月二十八日午时，授关尹道德二经，及太清九丹八天隐文西升教诚等法。 尹付杜真人，真人付小尹真人，此乃道德自然之始也。 至汉灵光和二年，太极徐真人於天台山，授太极左仙嗡真人灵宝众经，是谓洞玄洞神众箓之祖也。 又后汉顺帝汉安元年五月一日，老君降鹤呜山，授张天师二十四阶秘箓印等，及於玉局观授延生斩邪之卫，是惟正一盟威之宗也。 伏自周秦汉魏之间，三经虽传于世而科品未彰。 至晋哀兴宁二年甲子正月先农日，紫虚元君南岳夫人，始以上情授东华上佐司命杨真人。 彼时，天经宝文并作云书龙篆八会之体，非世间可得而究识焉。 真人别有符文经诀，变作隶书，自此流传方盛，是为上清之祖也。 独吾正法出于大宋盛时，本山有桥仙观灵迹，俨然是也。 悲夫，不得其人，渐失宗旨。 臣受持在末，滥领条纲，哀法衰微，谛承师训，亲受太上四阶经箓秘要符文，岂敢不精思运神，实恐辜负先圣。 故将所得妙道重删，《天心正法》一部，分为上下二卷仍略。 今时法师所用符咒，皆是北帝符，别作三卷，名日《北帝符文》。 在正法之外，及修三洞四阶宝箓秘谱焉。 传教修道之士，其出者箓，度脱舍生，同归大道矣。 邓有功撰。 上清天心正法卷之一

**The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity**

**Title:** *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity*
Compiled by Deng Yougong of the Southern Song Dynasty. Seven fascicles.
Source text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Dongxuan Section, Methods Category.

**Preface to *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart of Supreme Clarity***

Of old, Fuqiu, Wang, and Guo Chong—three sages who embodied the manifestations of the Three Clarities—first revealed their traces upon Huagai Peak, extending to the wondrous realms of Miaogao in the east and west of Jiangnan. Their sacred titles and auspicious signs were clearly transmitted in the *Jade Tablets*, and thus shall not be elaborated here. Their works brought blessings to the world, vast and beyond comprehension.

Later, in the *Book of the Great Clarity’s Subjugation of Demons*, they expounded this teaching precisely in the *jiawu* year of the Lower Epoch’s mortal era. During the reign of the Song Dynasty’s Chongxing Great Dao, on the fifteenth day of the eighth month in the fifth year of Chunhua, a colossal immortal in the flesh beheld upon the mountain’s summit five-colored radiance of precious light piercing the heavens. The following dawn, he traced the source of the light to the ethereal altar of the Three Clarities. There, he dug three feet deep and unearthed a golden casket. Upon opening it, he discovered a set of golden tablets inscribed with jade script—a secret formula of the Celestial Heart, titled *The Orthodox Method*.

Reverent indeed! This *Orthodox Method* is the heart-guard of the Jade Emperor, the true scripture of the Great Clarity, the wondrous Dharma of the Most High, and the numinous writings of the Three Caverns, together forming the fourfold register of scriptures. These are the *Dongxuan*, *Dongshen*, and *Dongzhen* Lingbao texts, originating from the natural inception of the Dao and virtue.

The great adept was the lay scholar Rao, styled Dongtian. Though he obtained the secret texts, he did not yet grasp the essentials of their jade protocols and ritual applications. He then encountered a divine being who directed him to seek instruction from Master Tan, styled Zixiao. From Zixiao, he received the Dao. Zixiao further instructed him to visit the Heavenly Equal Benevolent Sage Emperor of Mount Tai, where he obtained the Perfect Wondrous Jade and petitioned for the aid of yin soldiers.

The great adept became the first patriarch of the Celestial Heart, titled *Orthodox Method Meritorious Minister, Daily Attendant of the Northern Culmen, and Commander of the Demon-Quelling Court*. At his ascension, he transmitted the method to his disciple Zhu Jianguan, styled Zhongsu. Zhongsu then passed it to You Daoshou, who in turn transmitted it to the *Tongzhi Lang* Zou Ze. Zou Ze conveyed it to my own master of talismanic methods, Master Tianxin, and thus it has been transmitted to me, Yougong, to the present day.

Now, Huagai Peak is the ethereal realm of the Three Clarities’ manifestation, where only the Numinous Altar of the Primordial Sovereign exists, devoid of Daoist dwellings. Thus, the name of Huagai was unknown to the people of the time. Here, I present the general origins of the scriptural register.

In the twenty-fifth year of King Zhao of Zhou, on the twenty-eighth day of the twelfth month at noon, the Old Lord transmitted the *Dao* and *Virtue* scriptures to Guan Yin, along with the *Great Clarity’s Nine Elixirs*, the *Hidden Writings of the Eight Heavens*, and the *Western Ascension’s Admonitions*. Yin passed them to the Perfected Du, who then transmitted them to the Lesser Perfected Yin—this marks the natural inception of the Dao and virtue.

By the second year of Guanghe in the Han Dynasty, the Supreme Pole Perfected Xu, on Mount Tiantai, transmitted the *Lingbao* scriptures to the Left Immortal of the Supreme Pole, Weng the Perfected. These are the ancestral texts of the *Dongxuan* and *Dongshen* registers.

Later, in the first year of Han’an during the reign of Emperor Shun of the Later Han, on the first day of the fifth month, the Old Lord descended upon Mount Heming and bestowed upon Heavenly Master Zhang the twenty-four secret registers, seals, and other talismans. At the Jade Bureau Abbey, he transmitted the methods for prolonging life and beheading demons—these are the foundation of the *Zhengyi* Alliance of Might.

From the Zhou, Qin, Han, and Wei dynasties onward, though the Three Scriptures were transmitted in the world, their regulations and ranks remained obscure. In the second year of Xingning during the reign of Emperor Ai of Jin, on the *jiazi* day of the first month—the Day of the First Farmer—the Purple Void Primordial Sovereign, the Lady of Southern Marchmount, first revealed the celestial circumstances to Yang the Perfected, the Eastern Flower’s Assistant Director of Destinies. At that time, the celestial scriptures and precious texts were written in cloud scripts, dragon seal scripts, and the eightfold assembly of characters—beyond the comprehension of the mortal world.

The Perfected One possessed separate talismanic texts and scriptural essentials, which he transformed into clerical script. From then on, their transmission flourished, becoming the origin of the *Shangqing* tradition.

Our *Orthodox Method* alone emerged during the flourishing era of the Great Song. On this mountain, the immortal traces of Qiaoxian Abbey remain evident. Alas! Without the right person, the lineage’s essence gradually faded. I, who uphold this teaching in its latter days, have presumptuously taken up its principles. Grieving the decline of the Dharma, I earnestly received my master’s instructions and personally inherited the secret essentials and talismanic writings of the Fourfold Register of the Most High. How could I dare not refine my thoughts and mobilize my spirit, lest I betray the former sages?

Thus, I have meticulously edited the wondrous Dao I received, compiling *The Orthodox Daoist Method of the Celestial Heart* into two fascicles, upper and lower, still in summary form. The talismans and incantations used by contemporary ritual masters are all those of the Northern Emperor, which I have separately compiled into three fascicles, titled *Talismanic Writings of the Northern Emperor*. These exist outside the *Orthodox Method*, along with the secret registers and charts for cultivating the Three Caverns and Fourfold Registers.

For those who transmit the teachings and cultivate the Dao, the registers they bestow shall deliver and liberate the living, guiding all to return to the Great Dao.

Compiled by Deng Yougong.

chunks.original_text: 三光正炁 三光者，日月星也。 日君炁以本，日采炁时，其方取也。 存见日轮，光芒如赤火色。 月君炁以日，日常加卯，五日两宫移。 如每月初一日，便从卯上起卯，午时正在午上。 初二日亦同。 初三日午，后退过寅，如午时便从寅上起，卯至巳上见午时，即是太阴在巳。 存见月宫，光芒如暖玉银色。 天罡炁天罡星，约离斗柄三丈。 余诗云：月月常加戍，时时见破军。 要知端的处，向背问元因。 以月辰过将加戍，未过将加玄，数过取炁时，乃是天罡建破军之所。 向背者，乃阴阳日存想也。 阳日，天罡正面行。 面如炎火色，身衣红罗衣，顶上有青黄红三色炁，口吐火光万丈。 左手结天罡杀鬼印，即局邪诀。 右手执宝珠，随炁收入口中，任意发用存见，火光细如丝雾，灿灿有声，灌溉其身。 阴日，天罡反面行。 面如暖玉色，身衣素罗衣，顶出青红黄三色炁，口吐银光万丈，其细如丝，灿灿有声，左手结印叉腰，右手仗三昧火剑。 存毕随炁收入口中，任意用。 依此万无一失，不可轻泄，戒慎之焉。 请服太阳炁 每以日高三丈时，数日辰方，望太阳焚香，心拜九过。 默云：臣某上告 日君、太阳帝君、日宫神仙圣众，愿降瑶光真炁，灌注臣身中。 次掐卯文，默念日君内讳郁仪二字九徧。 存见真炁毕，即默念日君七杀咒曰： 唵嚩□啰□□哩娑诃。 一徧。
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Radiant Qi of the Pristine Essence

The Three Radiants are the sun, moon, and stars.

**Solar Qi**
The Solar Lord’s qi is rooted in its essence. When drawing solar qi, one must face its direction. Visualize the solar orb, its radiance like crimson flame.

**Lunar Qi**
The Lunar Lord’s qi is derived from the sun. The sun’s position advances daily at *mao* (5–7 a.m.), shifting between the two palaces every five days. For example, on the first day of the lunar month, begin at *mao* (east), with noon (*wu*) directly at *wu* (south). The second day follows the same pattern. On the third day, after noon, the position retrogrades past *yin* (3–5 a.m.); thus, at noon, begin at *yin* (east-northeast), and when *mao* (east) reaches *si* (south-southeast), noon corresponds to the moon’s presence in *si*. Visualize the lunar palace, its radiance like warm jade or silver.

**Celestial Stem Qi**
The Celestial Stem Star lies approximately three *zhang* from the handle of the Dipper. As the verse states:
*"Each month it ever rests at *xu*,
At every hour, *Po Jun* appears.
To know its true location,
Face or turn—ask the primal cause."*

When the lunar phase has passed the general, apply *xu*; if not yet passed, apply *xuan*. Count the hours to determine the moment for drawing qi, which is where the Celestial Stem establishes *Po Jun*. "Facing or turning" refers to the visualization of yin and yang days.

On yang days, the Celestial Stem moves forward. Visualize its face like blazing fire, clad in a robe of red silk, with three-colored qi—azure, yellow, and red—crowning its head. Its mouth emits flames ten thousand *zhang* long. With the left hand, form the Celestial Stem’s Demon-Slaying Seal (the *Ju Xie* mudra). In the right hand, it holds a precious pearl, which it draws back into its mouth along with the qi. As you visualize, the firelight becomes fine as thread or mist, shimmering with sound, bathing your body.

On yin days, the Celestial Stem moves in reverse. Visualize its face like warm jade, clad in plain silk, with three-colored qi—azure, red, and yellow—rising from its crown. Its mouth emits silver light ten thousand *zhang* long, fine as thread, shimmering with sound. The left hand forms the seal at the waist, while the right wields the Sword of Samādhi Fire. Upon completion, draw the qi into the mouth and employ it as needed. Adhere to this method without fail; do not disclose it lightly. Exercise caution.

**Invoking and Absorbing Solar Qi**
When the sun has risen three *zhang* high, determine its directional position. Face the sun, burn incense, and bow nine times in silence, reciting:
*"Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the Solar Lord, the August Emperor of the Sun, and the divine immortals of the Solar Palace to bestow the radiant true qi of *Yao Guang*, infusing it into my body."*

Next, press the *mao* mudra and silently recite the Solar Lord’s esoteric name, *Yu Yi*, nine times. Upon visualizing the true qi, silently recite the Solar Lord’s Seven Slaying Incantation:
*"Om va [ ] ra [ ] [ ] li svāhā."* (Once.)

chunks.original_text: 鼻引青炁，九次一吞。 如此九徧，吞炁九口，讫心拜礼谢而退。 请服太阴炁 每以月高三丈时，算太阴在何方，焚香心拜九过，默云：臣某上告月府太阴皇君、月府神仙圣众，愿降瑶光真炁，降注臣身中。 次掐酉文默念月君内讳结璘二字九徧。 存见真炁毕，即默念月君七缚本身梵咒： 唵嚩明啰叽啰娑婆萨诃。 一徧。 鼻引白炁，九次一吞。 如此九徧，吞炁九口毕，心拜礼谢而退。 请服天罡炁 每日高三丈时，算天是在何处，焚香箔辰文，默念咒曰： 日灵月灵，斗下交并。 天罡正炁，来灌我形。 出邪入正，永保长生。 急急如律令。 念三徧，存见天罡，心拜九过默念云：臣某上告 天罡大圣破军星君，愿降瑶光真炁，灌注臣身心五脏六腑，三百六十骨节之内，八万四千毫窍之中，驱逐病炁鬼炁。 咒曰： 年灾月厄，日灾时厄，驱邪邪走，驱秽秽亡。 众神扶我，身入魁罡。 人归依，鬼归降。 急急如律令。 默念一徧，吹左辰文，右剑诀，念天罡正炁咒，曰： 天帝释章，佩带天罡，五方凶恶之鬼，何不消亡。 飞光一吸，万鬼伏藏。 天罡大圣，杀入鬼心。 急急如律令。 念三徧，引炁三口吞之。 再念天罡内讳飞仙二字三徧，取炁三口，再念隐咒曰： 唵吽吽喗哒哩娑诃。 取炁三口，共九口吞讫。 再拜九过，礼谢而退。 凡法官，若能请三光炁，日夕不怠，千日功成。 滋悦颜色，壮体轻身，免诸百病。 若终身不倦，渐入仙真功力，难可尽言。 若只服得千日，凡遇治病，不用算取方上存想，但只一念布炁，吹於病身，自然安愈，万邪降伏，可不敬乎。 治病行符 凡救民疾苦，驱邪治病，接投状佥押讫。 次於神将前，梼祝将吏。 仍先令本人家备香，等候亲去。 如是顽祟，须变神步罡。 先从本坛发远罩去，指挥罩定鬼祟。 次发神将几员，带领精兵，前去收捉。 次第方可出门，临出门时，先於法坛内叩卓三下，双手玉清诀，念啼字七声，存诸神吏，都在面前。 次第将带而去，遥望见患人家时便下。 近罩指挥讫，左手捉鬼诀，右手剑诀，望北吸炁一口，咒日： 吾呼四圣急捉将，大急。 为吾前去，捉下邪鬼，毋令走透。 疾疾。 次发诀，存四神将带兵前去同捉收邪鬼，连诀吹去？ 次到本人门首丁立，掐本诀。 默念咒曰： 开天门，亥文。 闭地户。 巳文。 留人门，申文。 塞鬼路。 寅文。 横金梁，竖玉柱。 辰至杀。 收罡炁，辰文。 箔斗诀。 斗印。 众神藏，万鬼灭。 急急如律令。 次剔斗，盖头藏身，口念手拾。 曰：贪巨禄文廉武破，于左。 □□□□□□□。 于右。
chunks.translated_text:
**Absorbing Lunar Qi**
When the moon has risen three *zhang* high, determine its directional position. Face the moon, burn incense, and bow nine times in silence, reciting:
*"Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the August Sovereign of the Lunar Palace, the divine immortals of the Lunar Mansion, to bestow the radiant true qi of *Yao Guang*, infusing it into my body."*

Next, press the *you* mudra and silently recite the Lunar Lord’s esoteric name, *Jie Lin*, nine times. Upon visualizing the true qi, silently recite the Lunar Lord’s Seven Slaying Incantation for the Self:
*"Om va miṃ ra jī ra svāha saha."* (Once.)

Inhale the white qi through the nose, swallowing once every nine breaths. Repeat this nine times, ingesting nine mouthfuls of qi. Upon completion, bow in silent gratitude and withdraw.

**Invoking and Absorbing Celestial Stem Qi**
When the sun has risen three *zhang* high, determine the position of the Celestial Stem. Burn incense, press the *chen* mudra, and silently recite the incantation:
*"Spirit of the sun, spirit of the moon, conjoined beneath the Dipper.
The true qi of the Celestial Stem descends to bathe my form.
Expel the perverse, embrace the upright; eternally preserve long life.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"* (Thrice.)

Visualize the Celestial Stem, bow nine times in silence, and recite:
*"Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the Great Sage of the Celestial Stem, the Star Lord *Po Jun*, to bestow the radiant true qi of *Yao Guang*, infusing it into my body—heart, five viscera, six bowels, three hundred sixty bones, and eighty-four thousand pores—driving out pathogenic qi and demonic qi."*

Recite the incantation:
*"Yearly calamities, monthly misfortunes, daily disasters, hourly afflictions—
Expel the perverse, banish the foul.
All spirits aid me, my body enters the *Kui Gang*.
Humans take refuge, demons submit.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"* (Once.)

Blow upon the left *chen* mudra, form the Sword Mudra with the right hand, and recite the Celestial Stem’s True Qi Incantation:
*"Heavenly Emperor’s sacred decree, girded with the Celestial Stem—
Why do the malevolent ghosts of the five directions not perish?
With a single inhalation of radiant light, ten thousand demons cower in hiding.
Great Sage of the Celestial Stem, slay into the heart of ghosts.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"* (Thrice.)

Inhale and swallow the qi three times. Then recite the Celestial Stem’s esoteric name, *Fei Xian*, three times, and draw in three more mouthfuls of qi. Next, silently recite the hidden incantation:
*"Om hūṃ hūṃ nuṃ ta li svāhā."*
Draw in three more mouthfuls of qi, totaling nine. Bow nine times in gratitude and withdraw.

**Concluding Remarks**
If a ritual master can invoke the qi of the Three Lights without negligence day or night, their merit will be perfected in a thousand days. Their complexion will flourish, their body will grow robust and light, and they will be spared from all ailments. Should they persist without weariness for a lifetime, their attainment of immortality and divine power will be beyond description. Even if they only cultivate this for a thousand days, when treating illness, they need not calculate directions or engage in visualization—merely a single thought to project qi, blown upon the afflicted, will naturally restore health, subdue all malevolent forces, and command reverence.

**Treating Illness and Deploying Talismans**
When relieving the suffering of the people, expelling perverse influences, or treating illness, first accept the petition and affix the seal. Then, before the divine generals, pray and invoke the officers. Instruct the afflicted’s household to prepare incense and await your arrival. If the possessing spirit is stubborn, transform your steps into the *Gang* pace. Begin by casting a distant net from the altar, commanding it to enclose the demonic entity. Then dispatch several divine generals, leading spirit soldiers to apprehend it. Only then may you depart. As you leave the altar, strike the table thrice, form the Jade Purity Mudra with both hands, and chant the syllable *ti* seven times, visualizing all divine officers gathered before you. Lead them forth, and upon nearing the afflicted’s home, dismount.

Once the net is cast and commands issued, grasp the Demon-Seizing Mudra with the left hand and the Sword Mudra with the right. Face north, inhale a mouthful of qi, and recite the incantation:
*"I summon the Four Saints to swiftly seize the general—urgently!
Go forth for me, seize the perverse ghost, and let none escape.
Swiftly, swiftly!"*

Form the mudra, visualize the Four Divine Generals leading troops to apprehend the demonic spirit, and blow the mudra toward them. Upon reaching the afflicted’s doorstep, stand in the *ding* stance, press the appropriate mudra, and silently recite:
*"Open the Gate of Heaven—*hai* mudra.
Seal the Door of Earth—*si* mudra.
Leave the Human Gate—*shen* mudra.
Block the Demon’s Path—*yin* mudra.
Lay the Golden Beam horizontally, raise the Jade Pillar vertically—
From *chen* to *sha*.
Gather the *Gang* qi—*chen* mudra.
Press the Dipper Mudra.
Seal with the Dipper Seal.
All spirits conceal themselves, ten thousand demons perish.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"*

Next, trace the Dipper, cover your head to conceal your body, and recite while gathering with your hands:
*"Greed, Vastness, Prosperity, Literature, Valor, Destruction—on the left.
[...]—on the right."*

chunks.original_text: 双手天丁诀，二指掐大指根，大指掐中指偏。 想正一真人在前。 次存念： 东方青帝君佩剑立吾左，西方白帝君佩剑立吾右，南方赤帝君佩剑立吾前，北方黑帝君佩剑立吾后。 复存当院神将吏兵结阵围绕。 如果是强祟精灵抛砖物石，即再加护身法咒曰： 谨请西方明月太子，遂差五伯铁大掺贤，都在我边。 吾奉北帝敕，急急疾疾。 次西面，存明月太子侍从，五百白衣道人，头戴铁冠，手把剑。 念咒三徧，取炁三口，吹於左右。 次念咒： 北斗之神，盖护我身。 急急如律令敕摄。 再存北斗盖头上，则百邪不敢犯。 次入病人家，左杀右剑，叩门三下，指挥门神，不得纵容鬼祟走透。 速速疾疾。 次病人房门，令本人置香茶讫，变神步罡，入斗歪中藏身。 默告召将指挥勒令，唤召土地捉祟，烧符熏患身。 或不烧符，随意指挥捉祟讫。 法官吸患人炁一口，却更取水一口，噀病人身，左局邪诀，於胁下右剑诀。 令患人闭目，香熏其手喝去。 男祟左战，女祟右战，是鬼则战。 吾奉上帝敕，如此行持，有祟自然捉缚送出也。 须备符水之属，给与吞服。 次为念咒净身讫，法官闭目，三度左右雷局，念都天大雷公咒一褊。 吸东南方红赤雷炁，一口吹去，存为五雷电光闪雷。 用两雷局打去，存霹雳打破病人家，化为神仙宅宇，金阶玉殿，人皆化为神仙。 方可离本人家，去感应，桴鼓秘之。 上清天心正法卷之一竟 上清天心正法卷之二
chunks.translated_text:
Form the *Tianding* mudra with both hands, pressing the index fingers to the base of the thumbs and the thumbs to the sides of the middle fingers. Visualize the Orthodox Unity Perfected One standing before you.

Next, invoke in meditation:
To my left stands the Azure Emperor of the East, girded with a sword;
To my right stands the White Emperor of the West, girded with a sword;
Before me stands the Vermilion Emperor of the South, girded with a sword;
Behind me stands the Black Emperor of the North, girded with a sword.

Then visualize the divine generals, officers, and soldiers of the courtyard arrayed in formation, encircling you.

If the malevolent spirit is fierce and hurls bricks or stones, reinforce your protection with this incantation:
*"I humbly invoke the Moon Prince of the West,
Dispatch the Five Lords of Iron and the Great Sage Canxian to my side.
By the decree of the Northern Emperor—
Hasten, hasten, swiftly, swiftly!"*

Face west and visualize the Moon Prince’s attendants: five hundred Daoist adepts in white robes, wearing iron crowns and wielding swords. Recite the incantation thrice, draw *qi* three times, and blow it to your left and right.

Then recite:
*"Spirits of the Northern Dipper, shield and protect my body.
Hasten, hasten, by statute and ordinance!"*

Visualize the Northern Dipper hovering above your head—thus, no evil dare assail you.

Next, enter the afflicted’s home. With the *killing* mudra in your left hand and the *sword* mudra in your right, knock on the door three times. Command the door gods to bar all passage to ghosts and malevolent spirits—swiftly, swiftly!

At the door of the patient’s chamber, instruct the patient to prepare incense and tea. Then, step the *Gang* and conceal yourself within the Dipper’s curve. Silently summon the generals, issue commands, and order the local earth god to seize the malevolent spirit. Burn talismans to fumigate the patient’s body. If talismans are not burned, proceed at will to capture the spirit.

The ritual master inhales the patient’s *qi*, then draws a mouthful of water and sprays it onto the patient’s body. Form the *exorcism* mudra with the left hand and the *sword* mudra with the right at the patient’s side. Instruct the patient to close their eyes while fumigating their hands with incense and shouting the command. If the malevolent spirit is male, it will tremble on the left; if female, on the right. If it is a ghost, it will tremble.

*"By the decree of the Supreme Emperor,
Thus performed, the malevolent spirit shall be bound and expelled!"*

Prepare talismanic water and the like for the patient to ingest. Then, recite the purification incantation to cleanse the body. The ritual master closes their eyes, forms the *thunder* mudra thrice to the left and right, and recites the *Dutian Great Thunder Lord* incantation once. Inhale the crimson-red *thunder qi* from the southeast, blow it forth, and visualize it transforming into the flashing lightning of the Five Thunders.

Strike with the *thunder* mudra, visualizing a thunderclap shattering the patient’s home, transmuting it into a divine abode with golden steps and jade halls, its inhabitants all transformed into immortals. Only then may you depart the patient’s home. The efficacy of this method is profound—guard it as a secret.

*Here ends the first scroll of the Orthodox Heavenly Heart True Method.
The second scroll of the Orthodox Heavenly Heart True Method.*
